content: dan s minimalist scarf finished size approximately 6 1/4 x 90 www hookedupcrochet com cathycrochets@hookedupcrochet com skill level easy yarn dk weight 550 yards i used just over 4 skeins of filatura di crosa zara in color1469 the scarf is meant to be minimalist and a thinner yarn goes with that feel hook h-8 5 0 mm gauge not critical for this project abbr chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet single_crochet flo = single_crochet in front loop only slip_stitch = slip_stitch st = stitch instructions are written in american crochet terms chain 285 row 1 rs 1 single_crochet in each chain st turn clockwise note i turned first clockwise and then chained for the next row this created smoother edges row 2-4 chain 1 single_crochet in each st turn clockwise row 5-19 chain 1 single_crochet in front loop only of each st turn clockwise note you may choose to single_crochet through both loops for the first and last stitch of each row this may give you a more stable edge row 20-23 chain 1 single_crochet in each st turn clockwise at end of row 23 fasten_off if you are not doing the edge finishing see below if doing the edging continue with the instructions below edge finishing you could leave the scarf as-is but i like the crab stitch finishing also called reverse sin- gle crochet on the edges with the rs facing you start on the corner where you ended row 23 and do 1 row single_crochet all the way around the scarf when you come back to the starting corner slip_stitch in first single_crochet and my deepest thanks to my wonderful reverse direction do not turn and go left to testers troubleagain peggy wilson and right doing one single_crochet in each single_crochet all the way around to deb burger copyright © 2010 by cathleen e corbitt-dipierro this pattern cathycrochets@hookedupcrochet com do this reverse single_crochet you insert the hook in the front of the work yo in the back then draw up a loop through the stitch yo and pull through the two loops on the hook this will proba- bly feel awkward at first if you need a tutorial google crab stitch when you ve crab stitched all the way around slip_stitch in first st fasten_off and weave in ends blocking when the scarf was done i briefly soaked the scarf in cold water then gently squeezed out the water no wringing laid the scarf flat on a towel on the floor and blocked it to sharpen up the corners flatten any curling and straighten the crab stitch i found that this also softened the yarn
